title: Firefox repeatedly signs out of mozilla account
content:
I have Firefox 146.01 on 2 windows computers (windows 10 and 11), and on a samsung android phone. I have several extensions (eg uBlock) and I use ExpressVPN.

My mozilla account has a display name and primary email which I verified, and account recovery key enabled. There's no secondary email, no two-step authentication using a third party app. I can readily log the browser back into my mozilla account by entering the password and emailed 6-digit confirmation code, but then it logs me back out within an hour. Each of my 3 devices logs me out repeatedly.

In the address bar I type about:sync-log, and I was able to find the below lines in separate areas of several logs: DEBUG Status.login: success.login => error.login.reason.no_username DEBUG Status.login: error.login.reason.no_username => error.login.reason.no_username ERROR FxA rejecting with error UNVERIFIED_ACCOUNT, details: undefined ERROR Background refresh of initial profile failed: Error: UNVERIFIED_ACCOUNT(resource://gre/modules/FxAccounts.sys.mjs:1669:18) JS Stack trace: _error@FxAccounts.sys.mjs:1669:18 withSessionToken@FxAccounts.sys.mjs:876:18 ERROR Sync encountered a login error DEBUG Exception calling WrappedLock: Error: Login failed: error.login.reason.account(resource://services-sync/service.sys.mjs:1053:15) JS Stack trace: onNotify@service.sys.mjs:1053:15

Based on the above lines, can someone help me figure out why firefox/mozilla keeps signing me out?

Thanks so much
creator: mymail11

title: Site has seizure, screen stutters w/multiple screens' tabs appearring as scrolling to videos?
content: Hi. I have had an ongoing random problem on videos sites where while scrolling, about half way down page it will suddenly have a seizure, stutter, causing multiple copies of the window to jump up and down. If I "slowly" scroll back up to the "quiet" area (midway to top of screen) it will behave normally. I try and watch the video I had been watching when it went nuts, happens again. I 'think' I got by it the other night...somehow I don't think it was me, rather it just happened to snap back into place. It had been happening more frequently several months ago where it was a real problem, went through all the normally accepted ways of cleaning, checking and hunting for others having a similar problem. The latter is where I have normally found the best and most recent inquiry similar to mine. Good part is it's fast and I know it's not just me. Bad part is it's fast and nobody has had time to answer it. Then it suddenly just stopped. In fact, I had forgotten about it! The bane of my daily computer life for weeks was suddenly gone and I forgot about it???? Well, it reminded me today, it's back. Any suggestions? I had thought it was with some Microsoft changes that had been going on and that had seemed to be the consensus but? Thanks in advance.
creator: serenaschwab
